Ноо1еуу On the square - free values of cubic polynomials
does in fact hold when N ( ^ ) relates to the property that the special cubic 4л^ + A be square - free,  where к is subject to the obvious condition ft ф 0 ( mod 4 ).  The method depends both on the use of a sieve method and on the study of an inhomogeneous cubic Diophantine equation by MordelFs theory [ 7 ] of the representation of numbers by binary cubic forms.  Since,  however,  MordelFs theory in its original form is too restrictive for our purpose,  we develop the theory of representation by the binary cubic by a slightly different method,  which has perhaps the incidental advantage of being rather easier.  Although we do not give any details,  the methods of this paper are applicable to the more general cubic an^ - \ - Ъ and also to the case Z = 6r + 2,  / ( ti ) = an^''^^ + b. 
Notation
All binary forms occurring have integral coefficients ; their indeterminates are denoted by either x^?  /,  or X,  У,  or |,  ту.  The letter x^ when not an indeterminate in a form,  is to be regarded as tending to infinity,  all inequalities given being valid for ciently large X. 
The letters Z,  m,  and n are positive integers ; r,  5,  a,  ß^ у,  and д are integers ; /?  is a ( positive ) prime number ; A : is a fixed ( non - zero ) integer not divisible by 4,  the polynomial in^ - \ - к therefore never vanishing. 
The constants implied by the 0 - notation depend at most on k. 
Application of the sieve method
We begin by describing a notation for certain sums that occur in the exposition. 
Each such sum is defined to be the number of positive integers n not exceeding x for
which 4д^ + / c has some specific property,  the sum N ( a ; ),  for example,  which as already
indicated it is the purpose of this paper to estimate,  being of this type since it relates
to the property that 4 / г^ + A : be square - free.  We now introduce the sum N' ( a : ),  which is
to appertain to the property that 4 / г^ - f - / c be not divisible by the square of any prime
1 number not exceeding |,  where f = - r\ogx\ next H " { x ) is to appertain to the property
that 4л^ + / c be divisible by the square of at least one prime exceeding f ; while finally Hi { x ) is to appertain to the property that 4w^ + Ä : be divisible by L
As an immediate consequence of these definitions we have the inequality
H' { x ) — П " { х ) ^ N ( a ; ) ^ N' ( ^ ), 
from which it may be inferred that V\ ( x ) may be expressed in terms of W { x ) and H " { x ) by the formula
( 1 ) Щх ) = H' { x ) + 0 { H " ( x ) }. 
This completes the first stage of the estimation,  the next stage being to consider H' ( x ) and H " ( x ). 
The sum H' { x ) is estimated by a simple form of Legendre's exclusion principle without appeaHng to the methods of Brun or Selberg.  Letting Zj indicate,  generally,
